law.catch_line: Definitions -- Printing requirements for personal checks.

text.section: All checks provided directly or indirectly by a federal or state financial institution for use in connection with a particular personal checking account shall have the numerical month and year in which the account was opened legibly printed on the faces of the checks.

In the case of a personal checking account that is closed and a new account opened simultaneously upon the advice of the bank, the checks in the new account shall have the numerical month and year in which the closed account was opened legibly printed on the faces of the checks. If the closed account was opened prior to July 15, 1986, no date shall be required to be imprinted on the checks.

law.history: Created 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 105, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1986.
